Cancer Risk
label: Private well nitrate concentration (mg/L). It is calculated by the well nitrate test results within each tracts. Studies found long-term (> 10 years) exposure to water with nitrate levels above 5 mg/L leads to a higher risk of colorectal and rectum cancers (De Roos et al., 2003; Schullehner et al., 2018).
Ranking of clinical care among the state. It is calculated by variables related to access to care and quality of care. The larger value means lower clinical care level.

Relative Risk of Colorectal Cancer. It compares the cancer incidence probability in each unit against statewide rates (C. Ward et al., 2019). So a tract with the value higher than 1 means the tract is at higher risk to Colorectal cancer risk than the average level of the whole state.
